p: As observed in Table 5, Carica papaya and Cocos nucifera, showed the best anti-trichomonas activity with IC 50 values of 5.6 and 5.8 μg/mL, respectively. Moderate activity was observed with the species Bocconia frutescens, Geranium mexicanum, and Lygodium venustum with IC 50 values 30.9–60.9 μg/mL. The rest of the plants are considered ineffective as the IC 50 values were considerably greater than 100 μg/mL. Although effective anti-trichomonal, all plants were still very less effective than metronidazole with 0.037 μg/mL.
